headline: Trump floats declaring natl. emergency to save US film industry
summary: In the latest installment in President Trump's tariff saga, the US commander-in-chief has threatened a 100% tariff against foreign-made films, with shares of entertainment companies like Disney (DIS), Paramount Global (PARA, PARAA), Netflix (NFLX), and Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) reacting negatively to this headline on Monday. Yahoo Finance Washington correspondent Ben Werschkul comes on to discuss how Trump could use a formal declaration of a national emergency to achieve this.  To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

Discovery (WBD) reacting negatively to this headline on Monday. Yahoo Finance Washington correspondent Ben Werschkul comes on to discuss how Trump could use a formal declaration of a national emergency to achieve this.  To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: How Entertainment Stocks Are Reacting to the Latest Trump Tariff Threat
summary: Shares in Netflix, Warner Bros. Discovery and Paramount fell in afternoon trading following President Trump's plan to tariff films produced overseas. “If this is deployed on a wide scale, it may end up harming the very industry it is supposed to help,” Barclays analysts wrote in a research note.

headline: Trump's 100% film tariff: What this means for the movie industry
summary: Shares of major media companies, like Disney (DIS), Paramount Global (PARA, PARAA), Netflix (NFLX), and Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), tick lower into the red Monday morning as President Trump considers levying a 100% tariff against foreign-produced films. Yahoo Finance senior media reporter Allie Canal comes on Catalysts to speak more on this headline and the severe impacts these tariffs could have on Hollywood and the greater entertainment industry. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Preventing Hollywood's 'very fast death' could become Trump's 9th national emergency
summary: When Donald Trump floated a 100% tariff on foreign movies, he hinted that a national emergency declaration could be in the offing to achieve his ends. It is a strategy he is turning to often in his second term.

headline: Film tariffs, On Semiconductor earnings, Skechers to go private
summary: Yahoo Finance host Madison Mills tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including the pressure felt by media companies like Disney (DIS), Netflix (NFLX), and Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) on President Trump's proposed tariff on foreign-produced films; ON Semiconductor (ON) shares fall despite beating earnings estimates; and Skechers (SKX) surges after agreeing to a $9.4 billion deal to go private with 3G Capital. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Netflix, Other Movie Stocks Fall After Trump Threatens Tariffs on Foreign-Made Films
summary: Shares of U.S. studios and entertainment companies dropped Monday, after President Trump called for a 100% tariff on movies produced overseas.  Warner Bros. Discovery stock recently stood 2.7% lower. The company is behind this year’s highest-grossing film, “A Minecraft Movie,” which was partly filmed in New Zealand and Canada.

headline: Movie tariffs, Tyson Foods, United Airlines: Trending Tickers
summary: Brad Smith and Madison Mills outline some of today's trending tickers. US President Trump orders 100% levies on foreign-made movies. Netflix (NFLX), Disney (DIS), and Warner Bros. Discover (WBD) are under pressure after the tariff announcement. Tyson Foods (TSN) stock falls after the company reported quarterly results, which showed its chicken profits helped offset beef losses, though sales overall fell short of analyst estimates. United Airlines (UAL) cuts flights at Newark Airport as staffing shortages cause significant delays. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Buffett succession, US trade deals, Fed meeting: 3 Things
summary: At Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK-B, BRK-A) annual shareholders meeting over the weekend, chairman and CEO Warren Buffett announced he will be stepping down at the end of the year, to be succeeded by Berkshire Hathaway Energy Chair Greg Abel President Trump has signaled that trade deals over tariffs with other countries could come as early as this week. Federal Reserve officials will be convening in Washington, D.C. this week for their May FOMC meeting, starting this Tuesday and concluding on Wednesday, May 7, with the central bank's latest decision on interest rates and a press conference with Chair Jerome Powell. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

Federal Reserve officials will be convening in Washington, D.C. this week for their May FOMC meeting, starting this Tuesday and concluding on Wednesday, May 7, with the central bank's latest decision on interest rates and a press conference with Chair Jerome Powell.
